alert.note: Alert for Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 5:22AM CDT until May 07 at 9:05AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Maries River near Westphalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maries River near Westphalia. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.9 feet, County Road 615 just north of the U.S. Highway 63 bridge begins flooding at this height. At 14.0 feet, County Road 512 just south of Westphalia begins flooding near a small creek bridge near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 8.5 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 13.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg 7 am Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Maries River Westphalia 10.0 8.5 8.3 5.0 3.9 3.3 MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
